content.description:
“Funeris heu tibi causa fui? Per sidera iuro,

per superos et si qua fides tellure sub ima est:

invitus, regina, tuo de litore cessi.

Sed me iussa deum, quae nunc has ire per umbras,

(5) per loca senta situ cogunt noctemque profundam,

imperiis egere suis; nec credere quivi

hunc tantum tibi me discessu ferre dolorem.”

Aeneid 6.458-464
content.question:
Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. Identify one and only one of the things by which Aeneas swears in lines 1-2 (Per . . . ima est).

2. According to Greco-Roman mythology, which god ruled tellure sub ima (line 2)?

3. According to line 3 (invitus . . . cessi), how did Aeneas leave the shore?

4. Write out all of line 5 (per loca . . . profundam) and mark the scansion.

5. What is the subject of egere (line 6)? Write your answer in Latin.

6. (A) Translate in context discessu (line 7) and (B) identify its case.

7. To whom is Aeneas’ speech addressed?
